oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of James Holden Jackson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Half-length portrait of James Holden Jackson, Co. C, 31st Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA (A.H. Bradford's). The 31st assembled at Camp Trenton, Gibson County, Oct. 1861, where they organized as a regiment. The men saw action in southern Kentucky and West Tennessee. Family states that Jackson was at Corinth and captured during the war. He was born in 1837, married 3 times, and died in 1908. In civilian life, Jackson was a farmer and riverman.
